```{r setup}
library(ggplot2)
```

## Background

To use one of these themes in another file, load with readRDS() command.

For example:

```         
mytheme_base <- readRDS('mytheme_base.rds')
```

## mytheme_base

```{r}

# build theme
mytheme_base <- theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    # text size
    text = element_text(size = 14),      
    # title -> left-aligned with entire plot
    plot.title.position = "plot",     
    # y-axis label -> horizontal y
    axis.title.y = element_text(angle = 0,
                                vjust = 0.5)
  )

# save theme
mytheme_base %>% saveRDS('workshop_datavisR2/code/themes/mytheme_base.rds')

```

## mytheme_base_quarterpage

```{r}

# build theme
mytheme_base_quarterpage <- mytheme_base + 
  theme(
    # text size refinements
    axis.text = element_text(size = rel(0.85)),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = rel(0.85)),
    legend.title = element_text(size = rel(0.8)),
    legend.text = element_text(size = rel(0.7))
  )

# save theme
mytheme_base_quarterpage %>% saveRDS('workshop_datavisR2/code/themes/mytheme_base_quarterpage.rds')

```
